intro: Rhaphidospora luzonensis, commonly known as the Luzon spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique morphological features. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
